###########################################################################################
# Joint estimation of relative risk of dengue and Zika infections
# Journal of Emerging Infectious Diseases
#
# Model 1 - Departmental level. WinBUGS 1.4 code, data, and initial values.
#
# Adapted from: 
#
# Ma H and Carlin BP (2005) Bayesian Multivariate Areal Wombling for Multiple Disease
# Boundary Analysis. Technical Report. School of Public Health, University of Minnesota. 
# url: http://www.biostat.umn.edu/âˆ¼brad/software/mc.pdf
###########################################################################################


model{

	for(i in 1:N){
		y1[i] ~ dpois( mu1[i] )
		y2[i] ~ dpois( mu2[i] )

    	ynew1[i] ~ dpois(mu1[i])
    	ynew2[i] ~ dpois(mu2[i])

		log(mu1[i])<- log(E1[i])+a0[1]+  phiS[1,i] 
		log(mu2[i])<- log(E2[i])+a0[2]+  phiS[2,i] 
		
		RR1[i] <-  mu1[i]/E1[i]
		RR2[i] <-  mu2[i]/E2[i]
	}

	for(i in 1:N){	
			phiS[ 1,  i ] ~ dnorm(0, tauS[1]) 
			phiS[ 2,  i ] ~ dnorm(0, tauS[2]) 
	}
	

	for(p in 1:2) { 
					a0[ p ] ~dflat()
					tauS[ p ]~ dgamma(0.01, 0.01)
					}

	useless<-sum(num[])+sum(adj[])+sumNumNeigh+sum(R[1,])+sum(mu.phiS[])

#residuals

for (i in 1:N) { 
	e1[i]	<- (y1[i]-mu1[i])/sqrt(mu1[i])
	e2[i]	<- (y2[i]-mu2[i])/sqrt(mu2[i])
}

# predictive check on overdispersion
# OVERDISPERSION

Diagobs1 <- pow(sd(y1[1:N]),2)/mean(y1[1:N])
Diagnew1 <- pow(sd(ynew1[1:N]),2)/mean(ynew1[1:N])
PrCh1    <- step(Diagnew1-Diagobs1)

Diagobs2 <- pow(sd(y2[1:N]),2)/mean(y2[1:N])
Diagnew2 <- pow(sd(ynew2[1:N]),2)/mean(ynew2[1:N])
PrCh2    <- step(Diagnew2-Diagobs2)


}

# DATA

list(N=8.70000E+01, y1=c(4.19800E+03, 0.00000E+00, 0.00000E+00, 2.00000E+00, 1.05000E+02, 2.70000E+01, 7.55000E+02, 5.00000E+00, 0.00000E+00, 6.00000E+00, 0.00000E+00, 2.36000E+02, 0.00000E+00, 7.40000E+01, 8.60000E+01), sumNumNeigh=4.48000E+02, R= structure(.Data= c(2.00000E-01, 0.00000E+00, 0.00000E+00, 2.00000E-01), .Dim=c(2, 2)), mu.phiS=c(0.00000E+00, 0.00000E+00))


# INITIAL VALUES

list(a0=c(4.61906E-01, 1.66024E-01), tauS=c(3.40047E-01, 1.25654E-01), phiS= structure(.Data= c(7.32348E-02, -1.21512E-02, -5.61917E-02, -9.83648E-02, 2.33207E-02, -9.51226E-02, -1.13773E-02,
